parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
False, deceitful, lying, untrue. From pseudomai; untrue, i.e. Erroneous, deceitful, wicked.
A witness (judicially) or figuratively (genitive case); by analogy, a 'martyr'.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to stop, i.e. Restrain, quit, desist, come to an end.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
